required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Knowledge and Perspective of Healthcare Professionals About Female Genital Mutation
clinical_study.official_title: Knowledge and Perspective of Healthcare Professionals Related to Female Genital Mutation: a Regional Survey

lead_sponsor.agency: Piazza della Vittoria 14 Studio Medico - Ginecologia e Ostetricia

clinical_study.source: Piazza della Vittoria 14 Studio Medico - Ginecologia e Ostetricia

brief_summary.textblock: Each year over three million girls are at risk of being subjected to female genital mutilation (FGM) in several African countries. This regional survey aims to evaluate knowledge and perspective of healthcare professionals related to FGM.

detailed_description.textblock: The survey iscomposed of 4 different sections: the first section included questions about demographic data of participants; the second part evaluated responders' knowledge about FGM; the third section focused on participants' working experience with patients affected by FGM and personal attitude related to this topic.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean score related to knowledge about FGM
primary_outcome.description: 10-point score (0:minimal knowledge; 10: extensive knowledge) related to the knowledge of responders about FGM

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of responders with active role in contrasting the procedures
primary_outcome.description: Evalution of the personale attitude of responders to the topic (active role in contrasting the procedures)

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of responders feeling confortable in treating patients affected
primary_outcome.description: Evalution of the personale attitude of responders to the topic (responders feeling confortable in treating patients affected)

clinical_study.condition: Female Genital Mutilation Type I Status
Female Genital Mutilation Type II Status
Female Genital Mutilation Type III Status

arm_group.description: Healthcare professionals (medical specialists and general practitioners, medical residents, midwives, professional nurses, medical students).

intervention.description: The survey is composed of 4 different sections: the first section included questions about demographic data of participants; the second part evaluated responders' knowledge about FGM; the third section focused on participants' working experience with patients affected by FGM and personal attitude related to this topic.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- medical specialists
- general medical practicians
- medical residents
- midwives
- professional nurses
- medical students
- residence in Liguria (Italy)

reference.citation: Abdulcadir J, Catania L, Hindin MJ, Say L, Petignat P, Abdulcadir O. Female Genital Mutilation: A Visual Reference and Learning Tool for Health Care Professionals. Obstet Gynecol. 2016 Nov;128(5):958-963. doi: 10.1097/AOG.0000000000001686.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Piazza della Vittoria 14 Studio Medico - Ginecologia e Ostetricia
